text.text: The FM-7 is an 8-bit personal computer released in Japan in 1982. It is the first of a long consumer series that includes, among others, the FM-NEW 7, the FM-77 and the FM-77AV. It is composed of two Motorola 68B09 processors clocked at 2 Mhz, one main and one for the graphics. As well as 64 KB of RAM, it can display a resolution of 640x200 in 8 colors and offers 3-channel sound. The last model will be the FM77AV40SX released in 1988, which will allow up to 448 KB of RAM, and a 320x200 display in 26214 colors or 640x400 with a lesser palette.
